text: Gojri, also known as 'Gujari' is an Indo-Aryan language spoken by the Gurjars, or Gujjars of Northern Pakistan and the Republic of India. It is classified as a form or dialect of Rajasthani by the linguists. The language is mainly spoken in the Punjab provinces of India and Pakistan and also in Jammu & Kashmir, it is most closely related to Marwari and Gujarati. ==References== Category:Indo-Aryan languages Category:Languages of India Category:Languages of Afghanistan Category:Languages of Azad Jammu and Kashmir Category:Languages of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
title: Gujari language
